snippet: Will Allen and his business partner are accused of reaping more than $31 million in a Ponzi scheme that promised high returns to investors from funding loans to pro athletes.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission files civil fraud charges against former New York Giants cornerback Will Allen and business partner Susan Daub; accuse pair of reaping more than $31 million in Ponzi scheme; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: Will Allen and his business partner are accused of reaping more than $31 million in a Ponzi scheme that promised high returns to investors from funding loans to pro athletes.

headline.main: Former Giants Cornerback Faces Civil Fraud Charges
